definition: Life is short, learning is limitless/Ars longa, vita brevis
pinyin: ren2 sheng1 duan3 zan4 , xue2 shu4 wu2 ya2

sentences.english: Short-lived Sui Dynasty, Tang Dynasty, will soon be replaced.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝短暫，很快被唐朝取代。

sentences.english: Allow plenty of time for this deceptively short journey.
sentences.chinese: 有大把時間享受這一短暫的迷幻之路。

sentences.english: That human frailty you blather about.
You have a layover in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 你要在芝加哥作短暫停留。

sentences.english: He became acquainted with many well-known writers during her short stay there.
sentences.chinese: 她在那短暫逗留期間結識了許多名作家。

sentences.english: Lies are like flower in full bloom; they look beautiful but do not last long.
sentences.chinese: 謊話像盛開的鮮花，外表美麗，生命短暫。

sentences.english: Yet this latest pause in Pakistan’s political turmoil is likely to be brief.
sentences.chinese: 然而在巴政治混亂中這次最新的停頓被看作是短暫的。

sentences.english: The setback was only temporary, however.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個低潮是短暫的。

sentences.english: I briefly covet something, and then the urge passes.
sentences.chinese: 我會短暫地渴望一件東西，然後這種購買慾就消失了。

sentences.english: China defeated India in a short war in 1962.
sentences.chinese: 在1962年的短暫戰爭中，中國打敗了印度。

sentences.english: She was transitoriness just like snow.
sentences.chinese: 她就像雪一樣，是短暫的。

sentences.english: Fellow astronaut Liu Boming also emerged briefly from the capsule to hand Zhai the Chinese flag.
sentences.chinese: 他的同事劉伯明也從太空艙短暫探出來把旗子遞給翟。

sentences.english: After a couple of brief growth spurts, home prices have started declining again in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾次短暫的增長，房價又實實在在地開始下滑。

sentences.english: In real prices, oil briefly fell back to pre-1973 levels.
sentences.chinese: 實際石油價格甚至短暫回覆到1973年之前的水平。

sentences.english: Life is too short, the way it is, can not posthaste. ?
sentences.chinese: 人生太短暫了，事情是這樣的多，能不兼程而進嗎？

sentences.english: So look, really must thank the short life.
sentences.chinese: 如此看，還真應感謝人生之短暫。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to come and go/to have friendly relations with/in the past/previous
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
